descriptions.title: An Overview of the Closing Section
descriptions.content: This comprises everything from the end of the final chapter through to and including the title followed by rdzogs so. This is often labeled a “colophon,” but we have chosen to separate it out as a “closing section” since it is distinct from the following sections and at times contains considerably more information than merely the title. For Tengyur texts this often includes a statement indicating who wrote the text. Example: སུམ་ཅུ་པའི་ཚིག་ལེའུར་བྱས་པ་སློབ་དཔོན་ཆེན་པོ་དབྱིག་གཉིེན་གྱིས་མཛད་པ་རྫོགས་སོ།། Note: the closing section will often include data about who wrote the text. This is not an author's colophon unless it says something like "I, so-and-so, wrote this at such-and-such place, at such-and-such time, at the request of so-and-so" etc. The presence of any such parts of the statement identify the section as an author's colophon.
